subject: Physics
question_text: An electric dipole with dipole moment \(p\) and rotational inertia \(I\) is placed in a uniform electric field of magnitude \(E\). Find an expression for the oscillation frequency of the dipole for small amplitudes of oscillation about its equilibrium position.E−q+qpEquilibrium−q+qθDisplaced by θ
question_html: An electric dipole with dipole moment \(p\) and rotational inertia \(I\) is placed in a uniform electric field of magnitude \(E\). Find an expression for the oscillation frequency of the dipole for small amplitudes of oscillation about its equilibrium position.E−q+qpEquilibrium−q+qθDisplaced by θ

subject: Physics
question_text: [Figure shows: A semi-infinite rod lies along positive x-axis starting from origin. Point P is at perpendicular distance R from the origin on the y-axis. The rod extends from origin to +∞ along x-axis.](Hint: Separately find the component of Epparallel to the rod and the component perpendicular to the rod.)
question_html: [Figure shows: A semi-infinite rod lies along positive x-axis starting from origin. Point P is at perpendicular distance R from the origin on the y-axis. The rod extends from origin to +∞ along x-axis.](Hint: Separately find the component of Epparallel to the rod and the component perpendicular to the rod.)
option_a: Angle = 45° with rod, independent of R (correct proof required)
option_b: Angle = 60° with rod, depends on R
option_c: Angle = 45° with rod, depends on R
option_d: Angle = 30° with rod, independent of R

subject: Physics
question_text: A solid insulating sphere of radius \(a = 2.00\) cm is concentric with a spherical conducting shell of inner radius \(b = 2.00a\) and outer radius \(c = 2.40a\). The solid sphere has a net uniform charge \(q_1 = +5.00\) fC uniformly distributed throughout its volume; the conducting shell has a net charge \(q_2 = -q_1\). What is the magnitude of the electric field at radial distance \(r = 2.30a\) from the center?
question_html: A solid insulating sphere of radius \(a = 2.00\) cm is concentric with a spherical conducting shell of inner radius \(b = 2.00a\) and outer radius \(c = 2.40a\). The solid sphere has a net uniform charge \(q_1 = +5.00\) fC uniformly distributed throughout its volume; the conducting shell has a net charge \(q_2 = -q_1\). What is the magnitude of the electric field at radial distance \(r = 2.30a\) from the center?

subject: Physics
question_text: The volume charge density of a solid nonconducting sphere of radius \(R = 5.60\) cm varies with radial distance \(r\) as given by \(\rho = (14.1 \text{ pC/m}^3)r/R\). What is the magnitude of the electric field at \(r = R/2.00\)?
question_html: The volume charge density of a solid nonconducting sphere of radius \(R = 5.60\) cm varies with radial distance \(r\) as given by \(\rho = (14.1 \text{ pC/m}^3)r/R\). What is the magnitude of the electric field at \(r = R/2.00\)?

subject: Physics
question_text: In a chocolate powder factory, negatively charged powder flows through a cylindrical pipe of radius \(R = 5.0\) cm with uniform volume charge density \(\rho = -1.1 \times 10^{-3}\) C/m³. Electrical breakdown (sparking) occurs when the electric field magnitude reaches 3.0 × 10⁶ N/C. At what radial distance from the pipe center does the maximum electric field occur, and what is its value?
question_html: In a chocolate powder factory, negatively charged powder flows through a cylindrical pipe of radius \(R = 5.0\) cm with uniform volume charge density \(\rho = -1.1 \times 10^{-3}\) C/m³. Electrical breakdown (sparking) occurs when the electric field magnitude reaches 3.0 × 10⁶ N/C. At what radial distance from the pipe center does the maximum electric field occur, and what is its value?
option_a: Maximum E = 2.5 × 10⁶ N/C at r = 4.5 cm (No sparking)
option_b: Maximum E = 3.1 × 10⁶ N/C at r = 5.0 cm (Sparking occurs)
option_c: Maximum E = 1.8 × 10⁶ N/C at r = 3.0 cm (No sparking)
option_d: Maximum E = 3.5 × 10⁶ N/C at r = 5.0 cm (Sparking occurs)

subject: Physics
question_text: A nonconducting solid sphere of radius R has uniform volume charge density ρ. A spherical cavity of radius R/3 is created with its center at distance R/2 from the sphere's center. What is the magnitude of the electric field at the center of the cavity?
question_html: A nonconducting solid sphere of radius R has uniform volume charge density ρ. A spherical cavity of radius R/3 is created with its center at distance R/2 from the sphere's center. What is the magnitude of the electric field at the center of the cavity?

subject: Physics
question_text: Figure 22-53 shows two concentric rings, of radiiRandR′= 3.00R, that lie on the same plane. PointPlies on the central z axis, at distanceD= 2.00Rfrom the center of the rings. The smaller ring has uniformly distributed chargeQ. In terms ofQ, what is the uniformly distributed charge on the larger ring if the net electric field atPis zero?P (D=2R)RR′=3R
question_html: Figure 22-53 shows two concentric rings, of radiiRandR′= 3.00R, that lie on the same plane. PointPlies on the central z axis, at distanceD= 2.00Rfrom the center of the rings. The smaller ring has uniformly distributed chargeQ. In terms ofQ, what is the uniformly distributed charge on the larger ring if the net electric field atPis zero?P (D=2R)RR′=3R

subject: Physics
question_text: Figure 22-48. A thin nonconducting rod with a uniform distribution of positive chargeQis bent into a complete circle of radiusR. The central perpendicular axis through the ring is a z axis, with the origin at the center of the ring. What is the magnitude of the electric field due to the rod at (a)z= 0 and (b)z= ∞? (c) In terms ofR, at what positive value ofzis that magnitude maximum? (d) IfR= 2.00 cm andQ= 4.00 mC, what is the maximum magnitude?O+zR
question_html: Figure 22-48. A thin nonconducting rod with a uniform distribution of positive chargeQis bent into a complete circle of radiusR. The central perpendicular axis through the ring is a z axis, with the origin at the center of the ring. What is the magnitude of the electric field due to the rod at (a)z= 0 and (b)z= ∞? (c) In terms ofR, at what positive value ofzis that magnitude maximum? (d) IfR= 2.00 cm andQ= 4.00 mC, what is the maximum magnitude?O+zR
